intro: Grisollea, commonly known as the mountain cactus, is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and thick leaves adapted for arid environments. Its botanical features make it well-suited for survival in harsh, dry climates.
